q: How much pain they have cost us, the evils which have never happened.
h:
“How much pain they have cost us, the evils which have never happened.” —
Thomas Jefferson

q: There are more people who wish to be loved than there are who are willing to love.
h:
“There are more people who wish to be loved than there are who are willing to love. ” —
Nicolas Chamfort

q: Make yourself so useful to other people, that they think you are irreplaceable.
h:
“Make yourself so useful to other people, that they think you are irreplaceable.” —
Og Mandino

q: No valid plans for the future can be made by those who have no capacity for living now.
h:
“No valid plans for the future can be made by those who have no capacity for living now.” —
Alan Watts

q: Your visions will become clear only when you can look into your own heart. Who looks outside, dreams; who looks inside, awakes.
h:
“Your visions will become clear only when you can look into your own heart. Who looks outside, dreams; who looks inside, awakes.” —
Carl Jung

q: To travel is to be alive, but to get somewhere is to be dead.
h:
“To travel is to be alive, but to get somewhere is to be dead.” —
Alan Watts

q: People think you're crazy if you talk about things they don't understand.
h:
“People think you're crazy if you talk about things they don't understand.” —
Elvis Presley

q: Be not glad at the misfortune of another, though he may be your enemy.
h:
“Be not glad at the misfortune of another, though he may be your enemy. ” —
George Washington

q: Turn off your mind, relax, and float downstream.
h:
“Turn off your mind, relax, and float downstream.” —
John Lennon

q: Why change? Everyone has his own style. When you have found it, you should stick to it.
h:
“Why change? Everyone has his own style. When you have found it, you should stick to it.” —
Audrey Hepburn

q: Remember that sometimes not getting what you want is a wonderful stroke of luck.
h:
“Remember that sometimes not getting what you want is a wonderful stroke of luck.” —
Dalai Lama

q: Forgive those who have hurt you.
h:
“Forgive those who have hurt you.” —
Les Brown
